column4: does it use a memory card? you can put that in a memory card reader and mount that. thats what i do with my nokia 6600
yes it does.. but i don't have a memory card and i was wondering whether you could load it like a filesystem thru bluetoot
I have a friend who uses bluetooth with his nokia6600 but it uses nfs and it's a bit messy
i did configure the bluetooth with obex .. but.. the "bluetooth file sharing"  doesn't work
no, not on linux, because i have a memory card reader
it was giving me problems with windows too..
I've never got file transfer working well on bluetooth on windows
oh really.. .. it worked fine with mine.. but.. just that it always connected on port0.. i never could make it connect on the regular ports. !!
can you help me with mplayer ....
I don't use mplayer, only totem and xine
